title: How to write a page description about politics - Quora

response.answer_text: An oft-quoted Hemingway line is: “"There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter (or today, a tablet or laptop or whatever) and bleed.” But if you only need a single page, rather than a novel of a few hundred pages, it shouldn’t be too difficult. Step 1 … think about the topic. I’m not sure of what country you come from, but if you’re not from the U.S., maybe you can give some thought about what is interesting about your country’s politics. Is it legitimate? Is it corrupt? Is it somewhere in between. Assuming there are multiple political parties, you can describe them and compare them. Jot down some notes as you think about the topic and eventually, you’ll have the start of some thoughts that you can turn into sentences. Organize them, massage them, insert some additional information (for example, transitions from one topic or thought to another. Ideally, you might come to some conclusion … or if not you can say why you didn’t/couldn’t/etc. Before you know it … you should have a page (or more) on the subject of politics and maybe you’ll even need to trim it down a bit, if you run over.

The same way you would tell someone what you want/need to tell them. You can scribble that one a piece of paper, on a computer screen or say what you want/need to say into a recording app, then transcribe it.
